titleStmt.title: Sad and fearfull newes from Beverley. Or, the northern diurnall. Wherein is declared how a great barn of corn was set on fire, to the great dammage of Sir Iohn Hotham, and the inhabitants of the said town, and the manifold abuses that are daily offered to those that take part with the Parliament, by the cavaleers, and others that are in authoritie: namely, the Earle of Lindsey the Earl of Northampton the Earl of Newcastle, the Earl of Rivers. VVhereunto is annexed, A declaration of the Lords and Commons, concerning the particular actions of the said earles. Ordered that this be printed and published. John Brown Cler. Parl.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Abel.

titleStmt.title: Sad and fearfull newes from Beverley. Or, the northern diurnall. VVhereunto is annexed, A declaration of the Lords and Commons, concerning the particular actions of the said earles. Ordered that this be printed and published. John Brown Cler. Parl.

England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: July 26. London, Printed for I. Harnom,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
